snippet: Protesters upset over an American-made video denouncing Islam attacked the United States Consulate in Libya, while Egyptian demonstrators stormed over the walls of the United States Embassy in Cairo.
abstract: Protesters upset over an American-made video denouncing Islam attack the United States Consulate in Libya, killing a State Department officer, while Egyptian demonstrators invade the United States Embassy in Cairo; trailer for the video, called Innocence of Muslims, was uploaded to the Web by Sam Bacile, an Israeli-American real estate developer; assaults are reminder, on the 11th anniversary of the Sept 11 attacks, that rage against the United States still smolders in the Arab world.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: Protesters upset over an American-made video denouncing Islam attacked the United States Consulate in Libya, while Egyptian demonstrators stormed over the walls of the United States Embassy in Cairo.

headline.seo: Anger Over Film Fuels Anti-American Attacks in Libya and Egypt
headline.main: Anger Over a Film Fuels Anti-American Attacks in Libya and Egypt
headline.print_headline: Anger Over a Film Fuels Anti-American Attacks in Libya and Egypt
